Dialogue: Lily and James put their faith in the wrong person. Rather like you, Severus.

I have a few start of term notices I wish to announce. The first years please note that the dark forest is strictly forbidden to all students. Also, our caretaker, Mr. Filch  has asked me to remind you that the 3rd floor corridor on the right hand side is out of bounds to everyone who does not wish to die a most painful death. Thank you.
I have always prized my ability to turn a phrase -- words are, in my
The truth. Tell them Hogwarts is no longer safe. It is as we feared, Minerva. The Chamber of Secrets has indeed been opened again.
True. But ask yourself this: were you calling them? Or were they calling you?
Wand out, Harry.
Not a single professor inside this castle would help Sirius Black enter it. I'm quite convinced the castle is safe... and I'm more than willing to send the students back to their houses.

And now, Mr. Weasley, if you would, have an owl deliver these release papers to Azkaban? I believe we- we want our gamekeeper back. Harry first, I want to thank you, Harry. You must have shown me real loyalty down in the Chamber. Nothing but that could have called Fawkes to you. And, um second, I sense that something is troubling you. Am I right, Harry?
Dear lady, who did this to you?
And what of your activities outside the classroom?  Do they bring you satisfaction?

Today we acknowledge a really terrible loss. Cedric Diggory was as you all know, exceptionally hard working, intricately fair minded. And most importantly a fierce fierce friend. I think therefore you have the right to know exactly how he died. You see, Cedric Diggory was murdered by Lord Voldemort. The ministry of magic does not wish me to tell you this. But not to do so I think would be an insult to his memory. Now the pain we all feel at this dreadful loss reminds me, reminds us that while we may come from different places and speak in different tongues, our hearts beat as one. In light of recent events the bonds of friendship we made this year will be more important than ever. Remember that and Cedric Diggory will not have died in vain, you remember that. And we'll celebrate a boy who was kind and honest and brave and true right to the very end.
Certain? No. Little is certain in this world, Harry. Call it an educated guess.
Secure the castle, Mr. Filch. The rest of you, to the Great Hall.
I've never put much stock in miracles, Harry. On the other hand, I can attest wholly to the extensive advantages of a related phenomenon.
I should have known that you would be here...Professor McGonagall.
Do you remember your first year here? When you lay in the hospital wing fresh from your confrontation with Voldemort?
SILLLLLEEENNNNCEEEEE!  Everyone will please, not panic. Now, Prefects will lead their houses back to the dormitories. Teachers will follow me to the dungeons.

We will be able to cure her, Argus. As I understand it, Madame Sprout has a very healthy growth of Mandrakes. When matured, a potion will be made which will revive Mrs. Norris. And in the meantime, I strongly recommend caution to all.
Ah, yes. I was wondering when we'd hit that little snag.
Harry, I owe you this explanation, to show you the failings of an old man.
I want all the judges over here now.
Did you ask one of the older students to do it for you?
He has enough Elixir to set his affairs in order. But yes, he will die.
Belonged to Voldemort's mother. It was difficult to find and...
Sirius told me you believed there was a snake inside of you. This was Voldemort attempting to manipulate you. To protect you from this, I had you study Occlumency.

Today, of course, the world knows him by another name.  Which is why, as I stand looking out upon you all tonight, I am reminded of a sobering fact.  Each day, every hour, this very minute perhaps, dark forces attempt to penetrate this castle.  But in the end, their greatest weapon remains... you.
Mr. Filch? Round up the ghosts. Tell them to search every painting in the castle to find the Fat Lady.

Like cursing Katie Bell and hoping she would, in turn, bear a cursed necklace to me?  Like replacing a bottle of mead with one laced with poison.  Forgive me, Draco, but these are attempts so feeble I cannot help but question if your heart has been really in them. I'm curious.  When Voldemort gave you this task, when he asked you to kill me, was it in a whisper?

Our Care of Magical Creatures teacher... has decided to retire... in order to spend more time with his remaining limbs. Fortunately, I'm delighted to announce... that his place will be taken by none other... than our own Rubeus Hagrid. Finally, on a more disquieting note... at the request of the Ministry of Magic... Hogwarts will, until further notice, play host to the dementors of Azkaban... until such a time as Sirius Black is captured. The dementors will be stationed at every entrance to the grounds. Now whilst I've been assured... that their presence will not disrupt our day-to-day activities... a word of caution. Dementors are vicious creatures. They'll not distinguish... between the one they hunt and the one who gets in their way. Therefore, I must warn each and every one of you... to give them no reason to harm you. It is not in the nature of a dementor to be forgiving. But you know, happiness can be found... even in the darkest of times... if one only remembers to turn on the light.
You can do things, can't you, Tom? Things the other children can't.

There is a room in the Department of Mysteries which is kept locked at all times. It contains a force so wonderful and yet terrible that it is greater than death itself. It is that power which you have incredible amounts of and of which Voldemort has none.
... which are posted in an extensive list on the door to Mr. Filch's door.
What you see before you are memories.  In this case pertaining to one individual:  Voldemort.  Or as he was known then... Tom Riddle.
Enjoying your classes?  Professor Slughorn, for one, is most impressed with you.
and Mr Potter tied for first position they will be the first to enter the maze. Followed by Mr Krum...

No spell can reawaken the dead Harry I trust you know that. Dark and diffiult times lie ahead. Soon we must all face the choice between what is right what is easy. But remember this, you have friends here. You're not alone.
Good day champions. Gather round please. Now you've waited, you've wondered and at last the moment has arrived. The moment only four of you can fully appreciate.
It is the final burden which I must place on you, Harry.

What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally, the whole school knows.  Ah, I see your friend Ronald has saved you the trouble of opening your Chocolate Frogs.
The irony of course, Severus, is that -- in the end -- you and the boy desire the same thing...
And should I tell you to abandon me and save yourself...
Ah. You see, only a person who wanted to find the Stone, find it, but not use it, would be able to get it. That is one of my more brilliant ideas. And between you and me that's saying something.
If she means so much to you, surely Lord Voldemort would spare her in exchange for the boy.

I see. Well, you can speak Parseltongue, Harry. Why? Because Lord Voldemort can speak Parseltongue. If I'm not mistaken, Harry, he transferred some of his powers to you the night he gave you that scar.
Yes. You must be the one to kill me, Severus. It is the only way. Only then will the Dark Lord trust you completely.

Curiosity's not a sin Harry, but you should exercise caution. It's a pensieve, useful if like me you find your mind a wee bit stretched. It allows me to see what small things I've already seen. You see Harry I've searched and searched for something, some small detail. Something I might have overlooked, something that would explain why these terrible things have happened. Every time I get close to an answer it slips away, it's maddedning.
Hide yourself below.  And do not speak or show yourself without my permission.  No matter what.
I am well aware of our bylaws, Severus, having written quite a few of them myself. However, as head of Gryffindor house, it is for Professor McGonagall to determine the appropriate action.
You may begin at the start of the cannon.
Priori Incantatem. You saw your parents that night didn't you? They reappeared.
In point of fact, when young Potter met those students it was not illegal.
There is no shame in feeling pain, Harry. It is your greatest strength...

The first person to touch the cup will be the winner. I've instructed the staff to patrol the perimeter, if at any point should a contestant wish to withdraw from the task he or she need only send up red sparks with their wands. Contestants, gather round.
You were the seventh Horcrux, Harry; the Horcrux he never meant to make.

Another year, gone! And now, as I understand it, the house cup needs awarded and the points stand thus. In fourth place: Gryffindor, with 312 points!  In third place: Hufflepuff, with 352 points!  Second: Ravenclaw, with 426 points!  And in first place, with 472 points: Slytherin house!  Yes, well done Slytherin, well done Slytherin. However, recent events must be taken into account and I have a few last minute points to award.  First, to Miss Hermione Granger, for the cool use of intellect while others were in grave peril: fifty points!  Second, to Mr Ronald Weasley, for the best played game of chess that Hogwarts has seen these many years: fifty points!  And third, to mister Harry Potter, for pure love and outstanding courage, I award Gryffindor house: sixty points!
... I was merely curious. In any event, I'm sure you're wondering why I've summoned you here tonight.  The answer lies here.
Is there something you wish to tell me?

I often talk aloud to myself.  I find it extraordinarily useful. That which sounds sane at a whisper can seem utterly mad when said for all the world to hear. Haven't been whispering to yourself, have you, Draco?
One wintry afternoon, he lured two younger classmates to this cave. What happened is unclear.  But this much is known:  the children were damaged.
It is my fault Sirius died tonight.
But this is touching, Severus. Don't tell me you've grown to care for the boy?
Harry. You wonderful boy. You brave, brave man. Let us walk.
Relax, dear boy. The stone has been destroyed. My friend Nicholas and I had a little chat and agreed it was best all around.
Only, this time, he chose to act through somebody else, by means of this.
Earlier today Professor Moody placed the tri-wizards cup deep within the maze. Only he knows its exact position. Now as Mr Diggory...
There's been another attack.
Understand what I'm saying. Should I tell you to hide, you must hide.

No.  I did not.  You see, Professor Slughorn possesses something I desire very dearly. And he will not part with it easily... I'd rather not divulge any more just yet, Harry.  But I promise. In time you will know everything.
Stand up, Severus. I haven't much time. What message do you bring from Lord Voldemort this time?
Once he discovered the connection, Voldemort had little difficulty in manipulating you into thinking he had captured Sirius.
This magic is what your mother gave you when she died. That protection would only work, however, if you were cared for by a blood relative. Your Aunt, Petunia.
I also knew that Voldemort would return one day. I played to his weakness. There is an ancient magic which Voldemort has always underestimated.

I beg a few moments of your attention, as I have a few start of term announcements. Right off, our caretaker, the good Mr. Filch, has reminded me for what he says is the four-hundred and sixty-second time that he had an annually updated list of various banned items, usually introduced by our humour experts Fred and George Weasley...
Perhaps. Personally I've never had much time for heroes.
Yes. I thought he could overcome his feelings towards your father, but I was wrong. Some wounds cut too deep to be healed.
Minerva, the rest of the Weasleys will need to be awoken.
You forget that Sirius was my friend too. You are not the only person on this earth capable of feelings, Harry.
My word that I shall never reveal the best of you, Severus? If you insist.
Sit down please. And now the moment you've all been waiting for, the champions selection!
I understand Tom, but I'm afraid Headmaster Dippet may have no choice.
Ah, Professor, I would trust Hagrid with my life.
This is beyond anything I imagined.  In my life I have seen things that are unimaginably horrific.  I know now... you will see worse.
Ah- it would take a true Gryffindor to pull that out of the hat.
Not to worry Madame Maxime, our gamekeeper Hagrid's more than capable of seeing to them.
Just something to keep in mind. Now, off to bed.  Pip pip!
A passage, yes.  Very good. I once knew a boy years ago who made all the wrong choices.  Let me help you, Draco.
Innocent until proven guilty, Severus.
Too much... I can't... take it... I want... to die... kill... kill me... KILL ME, HARRY!
True.  But magic, especially Dark magic...
Argus! Argus, I Everyone will proceed to their dormitories immediately. Everyone except you three.
The Dark Lord will return. And the boy will be in terrible danger when he does.
And now our friends from the north, please greet the proud sons of Durmstrang and the high master Igor Karkaroff.
I would trust Severus Snape with my life, Harry. You have never recovered from your mistrust of him in your first year.
There will come a time when Harry Potter must be told something. But you must wait until Voldemort is at his most vulnerable.
The champion from Beauxbatons... Fleur Delacour
Oh, no, Harry.  Your blood is much more precious than mine.
Again, some wounds run too deep to be healed, Harry. Severus and Sirius never liked each other at school. This has never changed.
They can be anything.  The most commonplace of objects.  A ring, for example.  Or a book...
At times I forget how much you've grown.  At times I still see the small boy from the cupboard. Forgive my mawkishness, Harry.  I am an old man.
'Help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who ask for it.'
Attention! Attention! The winner is... Mr Diggory!
Ah, to be young and feel love's keen sting.  Come, everyone, I think Mr. Weasley is well tended.
Kreacher has been serving two masters for some months now.
Yes.  And I think... perhaps... I may have found another.  But this time I cannot hope to destroy it alone.
The very best of evenings to you! First off, please join me in welcoming the newest member of our staff, Horace Slughorn.
In order to gain passage, payment must be made, payment intended to weaken any intruder.
Lay back down. They must not think we have had time to talk.
But surely that is what's right, no matter what others think.
Now, as you know, each and every one of you was searched upon your arrival tonight.  You have a right to know why.
Perhaps. But for now, let him sleep. For in dreams, we enter a world that's entirely our own. Let them swim in the deepest ocean or glide over the highest cloud.
It's there.  The only question is how do we get to it?
Harry get away from there!
Minister, you will order the removal of Dolores Umbridge from my school.
My fault.  It's all my fault...
Confused?  I would be surprised if you weren't.

You are the worthy possessor of the Hallows, Harry, not me. I was fit to own the Elder Wand, because I took it not for gain, but to save others from it. But I took the Stone because I longed to recall someone who has long been at peace and for that I paid with my life.
There are other ways to destroy a man, Tom.
The Hogwarts champion... Cedric Diggory.
Speak to no one else... I... I shall wait here...
Ingenious.  Let me guess.  It has a sister.  A twin.
This is perhaps the most important memory I've collected.  It's also a lie. This memory has been tampered with.  In this case by the person whose memory it is, our friend Professor Slughorn.
If you and your men will proceed to the Death Room, you will find several Death Eaters which I and some others have apprehended.

The place to which we journey tonight is exceedingly dangerous, Harry.  I promised that you could accompany me and I stand by that promise.  But there is a condition:  You must obey any command I give you -- without question.
Mind if I take this?  I do love knitting patterns.
Ah, fascinating creatures, phoenixes. They can carry immensely heavy loads, and their- their tears have healing powers.
Well done, Draco.  But I warn you. Killing is not nearly as easy.
I am not worried, Harry.  I am with you.
Because I am much older, much cleverer... and much less valuable. Your good health, Harry.

Exactly, Harry! Exactly! Which makes you different from Voldemort. It is not our abilities that show what we truly are. It is our choices. If you want proof why you belong in Gryffindor, then I suggest that you look more closely at this. Be careful.

Your attention please! I would like to say a few words. Eternal glory, that is what awaits the student who wins the tri-wizard tournament. But to do this that student must survive three tasks. Three extremely dangerous tasks.
If you insist on trying to arrest me, I am perfectly willing demonstrate how useless such an attempt will be.
I think there is something trying to get out of your wardrobe, Tom. Open it.  Open.  It.
Exactly. He's better off growing up away from all that. Until he is ready.
This memory is everything, Harry. Without it, we are blind. Without it, we leave the fate of our world to chance.  You have no choice. You must not fail.
Is this about the Prophecy?
Have there been other dreams like this?
Like your mother, you are unfailingly kind.
Well, search the skies, if you must, minister. Meanwhile, I'd like a nice cup of tea or a large brandy. Oh, executioner, your services are no longer required. Thank you.
Hagrid! Relax. I do not believe that Harry attacked anyone.
Professor Slughorn, I'm happy to say, has agreed to resume his old post of Potions master.  Meanwhile the post of Defense Against the Dark Arts will be assumed by Professor Snape.
Now we know who's been stealing it from your store Severus.
There's a reason Harry can speak with snakes. There's a reason he can look into Lord Voldemort's mind. A part of Lord Voldemort lives inside him.
Rather unpleasant to behold, isn't it?  The tale is thrilling if I do say so myself, but I'm afraid now is not the time to tell it.  Take my arm.
Oh, I agree with you, Professor Umbridge. You do have the power to dismiss my teachers. However...
I will return here later tonight, after I have seen to Harry. It should not take long. He taps the Golden centaur head.
I will explain everything, Minister. Just as soon as I return Harry to school.
Now, now, Hagrid. Now, come on. All right. It'll be all right.

Oh not necessary Harry the minister and I are done. I'll be back in a moment. Minister, after you. Harry do feel free to indulge in a liquorice snack in my absence, but I have to warn you they're a little bit sharp.
And should I do so, what will you give me in return, Severus?

The counsel is very much aware you have given evidence on this matter. Severus Snape was indeed a deatheater and prior to Lord Voldemort's downfall turned spy for us at great personal risk. Today he's no more a deatheater than I am.
Minister, I really think I should sign as well.
Only recreationally.  You see, I believe one creates one's own luck.

Welcome! Welcome to another year at Hogwarts! Now, I'd like to say a few words... before we all become too befuddled by our excellent feast. First, I'm pleased to welcome Professor R.J. Lupin... who's kindly consented to fill the post... of Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher. Good luck, Professor.

Voldemort had an informant listening to my meeting with Professor Trelawney. Fortunately he was discovered before he could hear the entire prophesy. Voldemort had to act immediately, he didn't know the rest of the prophesy. All he knew was that he had to destroy the child who would grow to be a threat to his power.
Harry! Did you put your name in the goblet of fire?
Professor Dippet had that ling planted when he was headmaster.
A man has died here. And he won't be the last, you must take action.
No, Harry.  I do not pray.  I was merely closing a window -- the one that had allowed us to Apparate.
Now I want you to persuade him to divulge his true memory.  Any way you can.
Did. It was just destroyed only moments ago by none other than Voldemort himself.

Before we begin the feast, let us have a round of applause for Professor Sprout and Madame Pomfrey, whose Mandrake juice has been so successfully administered to all who had been Petrified. Also, in light of the recent events, as a school treat, all exams have been canceled.

And finally: it takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to your enemies, but a great deal more to stand up to your friends. I award ten points to Neville Longbottom!  Assuming that my calculations are correct, I believe that a change of decoration is in order!  Gryffindor wins the House Cup!
Additionally, we have Professor Umbridge, who has kindly agreed to fill the post of Defense Against the Dark Arts--
Also, we have two staffing changes this year. Professor Grubby-Plank will be taking the post of Care of Magical Creatures post as Professor Hagrid is on...extended leave.

Fortunately, our young Mr. Potter discovered it. One hopes that no more of Lord Voldemort's old school things should find their way into innocent hands. The consequences for the one responsible would be severe.
Haven't you wondered why I haven't spoken to you, even looked at you, for months?
I fear I may have stolen a wondrous night from you, Harry. She was, truthfully, very pretty. The girl.
An excellent question, Harry. The answer lies in the prophesy.
So why all the theatrics, Horace? You weren't perhaps expecting someone else, were you?
You should not have come here tonight, Tom.
I agree with Severus. Alastor, keep an eye on Harry will you?
No.  Severus... Severus is who I need... Go and wake him... Tell him what has happened...
That wasn't my intention.
This vial contains a most particular memory -- of the day I first met him.  I'd like you to see it.  If you would...
Indeed.  And quite successfully I might add.  Most people vomit their first time.
Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living and, above all, those who live without love.
For this reason the ministry has seen fit to impose a new rule. To explain all this we have the head of the department of international magic cooperation Mister Bartimus Crouch.

I think I know a lost cause when I see one.  Regrettable.  I would have considered it a personal triumph had you consented to return to Hogwarts, Horace.  You are, like my friend Mr. Potter -- one of a kind.
Tell me some of the things you can do, Tom.
King's Cross! Is that right? Well, this is, as they say, your party.
You're the Chosen One, Harry.  And Horace is, at heart, a decent man. Provide the proper circumstances and he will confess his sins.
The Second War has begun, Minister.
Is he in this room? Is he in this room?

Welcome to the second task. Last night something was stolen from each of our champions. A treasure of sorts. These four treasures, one for each champion, now lie on the bottom of the black lake. In order to win each champion need only find their treasure and return to the surface. Simple enough. Except for this, they will have one hour to do so and one hour only. After that they'll be on their own.
Phineas, I need you to visit your other portrait. Tell Sirius what happened and that we are coming to stay for a while.
She was quite right, Harry. Kreacher is what wizards have made him. He is to be pitied, not hated.

The goblet of fire. Anyone wishing to submit themselves for the tournament merely write their name upon a piece of parchment and throw it in the flame before this hour on Thursday night. Do not do so lightly, if choosen there's no turning back. As from this moment the tri-wizard tournament has begun.
Excellent! we now have our three champions! But in the end only one will go down in history. Only one will hoist this chalice of champions, this vessel of victory the tri-wizard cup!
Over time, while here at Hogwarts, Tom Riddle grew close to one particular teacher.  Can you guess which teacher that might be?
Ah yes.  Introductions.  Harry, this is an old friend and colleague of mine, Horace Slughorn.  Horace, this is, well, you know who this is. Apparently there's some thought he may be the Chosen One.

So Hogwarts has been choosen to host a legendary event. The Tri-Wizard tournament. Now for those of you who do not know, the tri-wizard tournament brings together three schools for a series of magical contests. From each school a single contestant is selected to compete. Now let me be clear, if choosen you stand alone. And trust me when I say these contests are not for the faint hearted, but more of that later. For now please join me in welcoming the lovely ladies of the Beauxbatons Academy of magic and their headmistress Madam Maxime.

It's a Horcrux, yes.  Four years ago, when you saved Ginny Weasley's life in the Chamber of Secrets, when you brought me this I knew.  This was a different kind of magic.  Very dark.  Very powerful.  But until tonight, I had no idea just how powerful...
I must say, you make a very convincing armchair, Horace.
How did you see this? How were you positioned when you saw it?

Back again, Harry?  I see that you, like so many before you, have discovered the delights of the Mirror of Erised. I trust by now you realize what it does. Let me give you a clue. The happiest man on earth would look into the mirror and see only himself, exactly as he is.

Oh, and about time, too. He's been looking dreadful for days. Pity you had to see him on a burning day. Fawkes is a phoenix, Harry. They burst into flame when it is time for them to die, and then they are reborn from the ashes.
But how she has been Petrified, I cannot say

For showing unique command of the bubblehead shark. The way I see it, Mr Potter would have finished first had it not been for his determination to rescue not only Mr Weasly but the others as well. We've agreed to award him second place! For outstanding moral fibre.
You are quite wrong, Tom, as you have always been.
Calm yourself, Hagrid. If the governors desire my removal, I will, of course, step aside. However, you will find that help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who ask for it.
This pain is part of being human, Harry...
One destroys Voldemort.
Only if the Dementors are still taking their orders from only the Ministry these days. I believe you know my views on this, Cornelius.
Your word, Harry.
Correct again. I must confess that I was, however, under the impression that this young girl only told you a meeting was going on tonight.
Kreacher lied. He wanted you to go to the Department of Mysteries.
Kill me!  It's the only way!
Ah. Apparently Kreacher had injured Buckbeak to distract him in case you tried to contact Headquarters.
You disgust me. You would sacrifice the life of an innocent child over a schoolboy crush?
Minister, you have just seen You- Know-Who in the flesh only seconds ago! It is time to come to your senses!
Good evening, Draco.  What brings you out on such a fine Spring evening?  Or is it Summer?
Naturally. All of you did rather well on your spellwork at this school, but if you attempt to take me in by force, I'm afraid I shall have to hurt you.
Send an owl to Azkaban, think they'll find they're missing a prisoner.
I'm not going into hiding. Fudge will soon regret removing me from Hogwarts.
When the governors learned that Arthur Weasley's daughter was taken into the Chamber, they saw fit to summon me back.
It means that our students are in great danger.
You have no idea the pain it causes me to tell it to you, even now. But unfortunately, I must.
Happily, that will not be necessary. I have found a successor
The Prophecy did not refer to a woman. It spoke of a boy born at the end of July --
She's not dead, Argus. She has been Petrified.
All Educational Decrees will be nullified and you will call off the search on Hagrid so he can return to work.
Well, I think it should be put back in order for them, don't you? Mind?
The Beauxbatons champion Miss Delacour has unfortunately been forced to retire. She will take no further part in this task.
Curiously, Lucius, several of them were under the impression that you would curse their families, if they did not agree to suspend me in the first place.
Three of our champions have now faced their dragons and so each one of them will proceed to the next task. And now our fourth and final contestant.
Is there anything in that box you ought not to have?
Do not ignore me, Severus. Was it not you who told me of Lord Voldemort's plan to have the Malfoy boy murder me?

Once there was a young man who, like you, sat in this very Hall. Walked this castle's corridors. Slept beneath its roof.  He seemed, to all the world, a student like any other.  His name? Tom Riddle. The Hall goes utterly silent.

In the maze you'll find not dragons or creatures of the deep. Instead you'll face something more challenging. You see, people change in the maze. Oh find the cup if you can, but be very weary you could just lose yourselves along the way.
No, Harry. I do not think it was you But I must ask you, is there something you wish to tell me?
Actually, if I think about it... it doesn't seem curious at all.
It's fine. Now listen to me, Harry. Keep studying Occlumency! Do everything Professor Snape tells you.
Welcome to the charming village of Budleigh Babberton, Harry.  I assume right about now you're wondering why I've brought you here, am I right?
You are not an assassin, Draco.
I suspect he is ashamed of it.
I understand how you feel, Harry--
Again, I cannot have you manhandling my students, Professor Umbridge.
But I do. You seem to be laboring under the delusion that I would 'come quietly.'
You'll not be going back to Little Whinging tonight, Harry.
Sometimes we see what we expect to see, Severus. Other teachers indicate the boy is modest, likeable and while no prodigy, possesses above-average gifts. Personally, I find him rather engaging.
During your Occulumency lessons, Professor Snape discovered that you were dreaming about the door in the Department of Mysteries.
Oh yes. We are in King's Cross, you say? I think, should you so decide, you would be able to, let's say, board a train.
Good evening, Harry.  You got my message, I see.  Come, come.  Sit.
Oh he succeeded.  And not just once.  Think, Harry.  He's just told us.
That was not the only place the Prophesy is preserved.
...the Ministry can only appoint new teachers if I cannot find one. I think you will find him suitable enough.
It is not wise to be wandering around this late hour, Tom.
Close your mind! You will understand, in time. Fudge is stirring.
Many of our previous headmasters and mistresses have portraits in other institutions, allowing them to move between them.
Forgive me, Harry, I...
He didn't hate Kreacher himself. Kreacher was a reminder to Sirius of the home he had always hated.
And there is sufficient evidence to have you both expelled.
Make it stop... Please... make it stop...
You will have to forgive me, Harry. You see... I didn't trust
I want it understood, Cornelius, that Hagrid has my full confidence.
Again, quite correct. However, I wonder if you have any evidence that proves this group has been meeting since then?
Perhaps not. But she took you in, however grudgingly. As long as you can call your Aunt's house your home, you are protected.

I do, Miss Granger. But the word of three 13-year-old wizards will convince few others. A child's voice, however honest and true... is meaningless to those who have forgotten how to listen. Mysterious thing, time. Powerful... and when meddled with, dangerous. Sirius Black is in the topmost cell of the Dark Tower. You know the laws, Miss Granger. You must not be seen. And you would do well, I feel, to return before this last chime. If not, the consequences are too ghastly to discuss. If you succeed tonight... more than one innocent life may be spared. Three turns should do it, I think. Oh, and by the way. When in doubt, I find retracing my steps to be a wise place to begin. Good luck.
I asked you to get to know Professor Slughorn and you've done so.
You both realize, of course, that in the past few hours you have broken perhaps a dozen school rules?

This appears to be a gift, Horace. You don't by chance remember who gave you this bottle, do you -- which by the way possesses remarkably subtle hints of licorice and cherry when not polluted with poison.
And now we come to the moment of terrible truth, the moment I have dreaded for fifteen years. The moment when I must lay another burden atop your already straining shoulders.
You do care. You care so much you feel like you will bleed to death because of it.

Yes...and no. It shows us nothing more or less than the deepest, most desperate desires of our hearts. Now you, who have never known your family, you see them standing beside you. But remember this, Harry. This mirror gives us neither knowledge or truth. Men have wasted away in front of it, even gone mad. That is why tomorrow it will be moved to a new home, and I must ask you not to go looking for it again. It does not do to dwell on dreams, Harry, and forget to live.
There is only the end of the prophesy which we haven't addressed. It states "neither can live while the other survives."
Are you alright Alastor?

Thievery is not tolerated at Hogwarts.  At Hogwarts, you will be taught not only how to use magic, but to control it. Understood? I'll be going now, Tom.  Leave your window open tonight.  An owl will bring you a message.  Read it carefully.
Very well. Good luck champions. Mr Diggory the sound of the cannon...
I was going to ask you that. Where would you say that we are?
Hogwarts is not a place for mad people.
I daresay I can. And if you actually do attack me with that wand, Harry, I'm afraid to say you will regret it.
Therefore, it is only fitting, that you both receive Special Awards for Services to the School.
Well, what exactly is it that you want with me?
I never liked these curtains. Set them on fire in my fourth year, by accident of course. I put you in terrible danger this year Harry I'm sorry.
Raise the alarm. We must make sure Arthur is found by the right people.
Is Arthur seriously injured?

It's true, Harry. You possess many of the qualities that Voldemort himself prizes. Determination, resourcefulness, and if I may say so, a certain disregard for the rules. Why then did the Sorting Hat place you in Gryffindor?
Yes. Voldemort has been obsessed with hearing that prophesy since he returned. Because of your scar, what he was obsessed with, you were obsessed with, in the form of dreams.

Love, Harry, love.  Ah. Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans. I was most unfortunate in my youth to come across a vomit flavored one, and since then I have lost my liking for them. But I think I could be safe with a nice toffee... Mm. Alas. Earwax.
I am not family.  But his name has been known to me since birth.
I once knew a Muggle girl from Liverpool with hair like spun silk.  No light could resist it...

On the night Lord Voldemort went to Godric's Hollow to kill Harry, and Lily Potter cast herself between them, the curse rebounded. When that happened, a part of Lord Voldemort's soul latched itself onto the only living thing it could find: Harry himself.
Fawkes, we will need a warning.

You remember the condition on which I brought you with me? This potion might paralyze me.  It might cause me to forget why I'm here.  It might create so much pain I beg for relief.  You are not to indulge these requests, Harry.  It is your job to make sure I keep drinking this potion even if you have to force it down my throat.  Understood?

You are talented, famous and powerful -- everything Horace values.  Professor Slughorn is going to try to collect you, Harry.  You would be his crowning jewel.  That is why he is returning to Hogwarts.  And it is crucial he return...
Quick thinking on your part, Harry.  Using a Bezoar.  You must be very proud of your student, eh, Horace?
Sirius was tending to the wounds when you called.
I notice you spend a great deal of time with Miss Granger.  One can't help but wonder if --
He was sent to Azkaban. Destroyed Barty to do it. But he had no choice, the evidence was overwhelming. Why do you ask?
Don't let him know though, he must be anxious enough as it is... knowing what lies ahead. Then again, we all are.
I think it's unwise for you to linger over these dreams Harry, I think it's best that you simply...
Whether it has or hasn't is irrelevant.  I will not negotiate this with you, Severus.  You agreed.  There's nothing more to discuss.
This is the place.  Oh yes, this place has known magic. Where you stand, Harry, Tom Riddle once stood many, many years ago, when he was but a poor orphan boy with a penchant for cruelty...

I feared that you would make the same mistake I made, that you would be intoxicated by the power the Hallows promise their possessor. But I crave your pardon, Harry. It's clear to me now, as it should have been all along, that you are the better man.
Did I know that I had just met the most dangerous Dark Wizard of all time?  No.  Had I...
Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry. But why should that mean that it is not real?

Ah, I'm afraid there are ways in which he can return. Harry, do you know why Professor Quirrell couldn't bear to have you touch him?  It was because of your mother. She sacrificed herself for you, and that kind of act leaves a mark.  No, no, this kind of mark cannot be seen. It lives in your very skin.

Now we're all settled in and sorted, I'd like to make an announcement. This castle will not only be your home this year but home to some very special guests as well. You see Hogwarts has been choosen...
Interestingly, there were two boys whom the prophesy could have been referring to. You and Neville Longbottom.
I don't think the minister's suggesting you had anything to do with this. How could you? You've been with us all the time.
